data.meta_description: Toronto Raptors suites at Scotiabank Arena can range widely in price. Generally, prices for fully-private suites will range from $4,500-$12,000 depending on opponent, day of the week, suite level and suite location.

Our 100% Guarantee

No matter what happens, Suite Experience Group has you covered - your suite will be protected by our 100% Guarantee.

The SEG 100% Guarantee

We guarantee you will receive your suite tickets in time for your event. In the extremely rare case that you do not, we will offer you an alternative option if available or we will refund you at least 100% of your total purchase price.

If the event is canceled or if fans are no longer permitted, you may choose to receive a full refund or a credit towards a future SEG purchase.

If the event date changes, you will receive the suite you purchased for the new date.

Please reach out to us if you have any further questions at [email protected] or 800-592-7043.

Toronto Raptors Suite Prices and Details

How much do Toronto Raptors suites cost?

Toronto Raptors luxury suite rentals at Scotiabank Arena typically cost between $4,500-$12,000 (USD) depending on opponent, day of the week, and suite level/size/location. Weekday games and popular opponents will be priced at a premium. In general, Raptors suites are cheaper than Maple Leafs suites

How many guests can fit in a Raptors suite?

Toronto Raptors suites vary in size and seating configuration. Most suites accommodate 12-20 guests. Executive Suites (200 Level) and Loge Suites (400 Level) feature 12 theater-style seats on a private open air balcony plus barstool seating at high-top tables. Theatre Suites (500/600 Levels) have a... MORE

Toronto Raptors suites vary in size and seating configuration. Most suites accommodate 12-20 guests. Executive Suites (200 Level) and Loge Suites (400 Level) feature 12 theater-style seats on a private open air balcony plus barstool seating at high-top tables. Theatre Suites (500/600 Levels) have a capacity of 8-12.

Suite Levels at Scotiabank Arena

600 Level Theatre Suite

8 Tickets

Catering Available

×

600 Level Theatre Suite Details

The 600 Level Theatre Suites are directly above the ones on the 500 Level. The 600 Level Theatre Box offers a great birds-eye view to the court or ice. They hold a max capacity of 14 guests. Restrooms are located just outside the suite on the private suite level. Each suite includes a Scotiabank Arena suite attendant and the option to order premium in-suite catering in advance.

To book a 600 Level Theatre Suite

Click on the event you wish to attend in the UPCOMING EVENTS section.

Gondola Suites

42-114 Tickets

Food & Beverage Included

×

Gondola Suites Details

Scotiabank Arena Gondola Suites are perfect for large groups. The six Gondola Suites in the arena can hold 42-114 guests. Most Gondola Suites are all-inclusive food and beverage. There are located on one sideline above the 300 Level seating sections. Gondola Suites are designed with a more open layout to ensure there is plenty of space for entertaining.

To book a Gondola Suites

Click on the event you wish to attend in the UPCOMING EVENTS section.

200 Level Executive Suite

12 Tickets

Catering Available

×

200 Level Executive Suite Details

200 Level Executive Suites are located just 30 rows off the court/ice. The 64 Executive Suites wrap most of the arena and will accommodate groups of 12-20 people. Restrooms are located on the exclusive suite level and each suite will have a Scotiabank Arena suite attendant to assist you. VIP Entry through Gate 2 is available for each suite ticketholder and in-suite catering options are available to order in advance.

To book a 200 Level Executive Suite

Click on the event you wish to attend in the UPCOMING EVENTS section.

400 Level Loge Suite

12 Tickets

Catering Available

×

400 Level Loge Suite Details

Loge Suites are located on the 400 Level on the West End of Scotiabank Arena. 400 Level Loge Suites feature 8 stadium-style seats on a private balcony in addition to stools directly behind them for viewing to the ice or court. VIP Entry through Gate 2 is available to all guests in a suite and the Loge Suites can also be catered in advance.

To book a 400 Level Loge Suite

Click on the event you wish to attend in the UPCOMING EVENTS section.

500 Level Theatre Suite

8 Tickets

Catering Available

×

500 Level Theatre Suite Details

500 Level Theatre Suites are the lower of two Theatre Suite levels at Scotiabank Arena. These are located on both the East and West ends of the arena. Theatre Suites can hold a max capacity of 14 guests. Each suite includes a Scotiabank Arena suite attendant and the option to order premium in-suite catering in advance. VIP entry and early access into the arena are a couple of the perks with being a Theatre Suite ticketholder.

To book a 500 Level Theatre Suite

Click on the event you wish to attend in the UPCOMING EVENTS section.

Scotiabank Arena Event Planning Guide

Catering

In-suite catering is arranged in advance for all Toronto Raptors luxury suites. Most Raptors suites come stocked with beverages(soft drinks, beer, wine) which are charged on consumption. Food can be pre-ordered or purchased during your event. On average, most people spend around $80-$100 per person.

×

Catering Details

The Scotiabank Arena suite catering menu features 24 pages of food options including themed packages, hot/cold appateizers, entrees and desserts. The Kensignton Market package (priced per guest) is an SEG favorite; the package contains nachos, chicken fajitas and buffalo wings. There is no required minimum spend.

Parking and Transportation

All major public transit systems stop at Union Station located beneath Scotiabank Arena. Toronto Raptors parking is very limited around the arena. There are two levels of private underground parking reserved for Raptors suite pass-holders. Public underground parking is located at 15 York Street.

Budget

Toronto Raptors luxury suite rentals typically cost between $4,000-$20,000 USD. Raptors suite pricing varies based on the opponent, day of the week and suite location. Additional costs would include in-suite catering which isn't due until the day of the game and transportation to and from the arena.

Dress Code

There is no strict dress code for being in a Toronto Raptors suite. If it's a corporate event, many guests will be dressed in business attire. Otherwise, most Raptors suite ticket holders are dressed comfortably in team-branded apparel or casual clothing. Comfortable shoes are recommended.

Venue Bag Policy

Scotiabank Arena bag policy allows soft-sided bags, purses and briefcases smaller than 14”x14”x6” into the arena. All bags and Raptors guests are searched upon entry. Scotiabank Arena will not store oversized bags. Strollers are permitted but must be checked at a Fan Services kiosk upon entry.

Entrances

Toronto Raptors luxury suite ticket holders have exclusive access into the arena. Scotiabank Premium Entrances A, B and C are located at Gate 2(Bay Street). The VIP entrances open 2 hours prior to a Raptors game. All other entrances at Scotiabank Arena open 1 hour prior to events.

Child Ticket Policy

Children under the age of 2 do not require a separate ticket for admission into the Scotiabank Arena. Any child older will need a ticket, even if attending a Raptors game in one of the luxury suites. Toronto Raptors suites provide a great private environment for families with young children.

Frequently Asked Toronto Raptors Questions

Will my Toronto Raptors luxury suite be completely private to me and my group?

Yes, all Toronto Raptors luxury suites will be completely private unless explicitly communicated otherwise.

How will I receive my skybox tickets?

All Toronto Raptors skybox tickets are mobile and will be delivered to you via email.

When will I receive my luxury box tickets?

Your luxury box tickets will be transferred to you 1 to 2 weeks prior to your game.

Please view our Frequently Asked Questions or Contact Us.

We are always happy to assist you.

Raptors Spotlight

Current NBA Season

Toronto has appeared in eight of the last 10 postseasons. The Raptors’ current roster should help that trend continue. Pascal Siakam is the longest tenured star for the Canada-based squad. Siakam just averaged a career-high 24.2 points while tallying nearly eight rebounds and six assists in 2022-23. Next to Pascal is young forward Scottie Barnes. Barnes averaged 15.3 points in each of his first two seasons. He is a strong defender and continues to develop in the passing game, dishing out 4.8 assists per game last season. And other starters O.G. Anunoby and Jakob Poeltl complement the lineup well with size and tough defense. New head coach Darko Rajakovic has Toronto headed in the right direction.

Scotiabank Arena has unique premium seating options for patrons. The Sher Club and Air Canada Signature Club provide great experiences and high-end amenities. The Sher Club, a... MORE

Toronto has appeared in eight of the last 10 postseasons. The Raptors’ current roster should help that trend continue. Pascal Siakam is the longest tenured star for the Canada-based squad. Siakam just averaged a career-high 24.2 points while tallying nearly eight rebounds and six assists in 2022-23. Next to Pascal is young forward Scottie Barnes. Barnes averaged 15.3 points in each of his first two seasons. He is a strong defender and continues to develop in the passing game, dishing out 4.8 assists per game last season. And other starters O.G. Anunoby and Jakob Poeltl complement the lineup well with size and tough defense. New head coach Darko Rajakovic has Toronto headed in the right direction.

Scotiabank Arena has unique premium seating options for patrons. The Sher Club and Air Canada Signature Club provide great experiences and high-end amenities. The Sher Club, a members-only area, is invite only. Designed for Canadian rapper Drake, the Club has top-notch service in an intimate 4,000 square foot space. The Air Canada Signature Club also has a fine dining restaurant and a premium bar and lounge. Suites at Scotiabank are also fantastic spaces for a group. The Mastercard 200 Level Executive Suites include a floor of 12 tickets (accommodate up to 20 guests), private in-suite service, early access, VIP entrance, catering, and more. The 500 and 600 Level Theatre Suites have at least eight tickets (accommodate up to 14 guests) with similar amenities.

Past Spotlights

After a down year likely due to playing their home games in Tampa, Florida due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Raptors returned home last year and were back in the playoffs as a 5-seed. They hope to continue to improve with reigning Rookie of the Year Scottie Barnes, who is back with usual suspects Pascal Siakam, Fred VanVleet, and OG Anunoby. The team has size, and Nick Nurse uses the matchups to his advantage.

If you haven’t checked out the Air Canada Club at Scotiabank Arena, now is the time. First-class dining awaits, and then at game time, head up to the 100-level seats that give you the best view of the game. The Mastercard Club Courtsides are another popular option, but the 200 Level and 500 & 600 Level Suites provide a luxurious gameday experience for workplace or family gatherings, holding from 12 to 40 people.

A return to normalcy is what the Raptors seek more than anything. After relocating to Tampa for a beleaguered season full of injuries and a COVID-19 outbreak, a return to Toronto in front of a full

capacity crowd is just what this franchise three years removed from a NBA Championship needs. Former Coach of the Year Nick Nurse will lean heavily on his “Big 3” of Pascal Siakam, Fred VanFleet, and OG Anunoby to get back to the postseason. Gone is one of the most highly decorated and respected players in team history, Kyle Lowry, but both Goran Dragic and Precious Achiuwa, who were acquired in that trade with Miami should see many minutes in the rotation. No. 4 overall draft pick Scottie Barnes could slide right into the starting lineup, potentially joined there by Gary Trent Jr., who made great strides in limited time last season. After a year without basketball in Ontario’s Queen City, fans can welcome themselves back with Scotiabank Arena’s most popular premium option: Platinum Club Seats. Terrific views come with access to the Platinum Club Restaurant. Scotia Club Combo Seats offer the complete entertainment package and admittance to the private Scotia Club. The Mastercard Club Courtsides remain the hottest ticket in town, but the Mastercard 200 Level Executive and 500 & 600 Level Theatre Suites provide a luxurious gameday experience for workplace or family gatherings.

How Do I Book This Suite?

INSTANT BOOK suites can be purchased online by clicking the INSTANT BOOK button.

Other suites can be purchased by clicking on the button and submitting your request. Our experienced sales staff is standing by and will respond right away.

Call us any time at 800-592-7043 to discuss options or ask any questions.

Catering, Transportation, and Lodging can be handled after your purchase by our world class support team.

×

Luxury Suite Costs

What determines how much a suite costs?

Suite pricing varies widely based on a number of variables including league, city, team, opponent, time of day, day of week, and suite location.

Day of Week: In general, suites can be slightly more expensive during weekdays (Monday through Thursday) because those days are ideal for corporations to entertain their clients in a suite.

League: NFL suites are the most expensive by because of the limited number of games (8 home games per team).

Suite Location: While just being in a suite is generally seen as the most desirable and luxurious seat in the building, some stadiums and arenas have multiple suite levels. If this is the case, certain clients are willing to pay a premium to be in a lower level suite that is closest to the action on the field. We will give you details on suite location as we provide you with availability for the game you desire.

Does it pay to wait to book a suite until closer to the event?

With regular tickets, prices will often drop in the days leading up to a game. While every once in a while the same occurs with suites, in general, pricing does not drop before the game. In fact, because of the very limited availability of luxury suites, it is advised to book a suite well in advance, as suites are often not available at the last minute. In addition, in coordinating events for larger groups (suites can hold up to 20 guests or more), it is often necessary to give guests a longer lead time to confirm their availability to attend.

Are there additional expenses I should consider?

If you are hosting guests in your suite, consider allocating enough budget to order catering for your suite. Catering is typically not included in the price of the suite. Suite Experience Group clients typically spend between $1,000-$2,000 for catering, with some clients spending even more if they order significant amounts of alcohol.

Are there discounts if I buy multiple games at once?

Some clients purchase multiple suites in multiple venues at one time. Suite Experience Group can provide special package pricing for clients who buy three or more suites at one time.

How can I maximize my budget?

If you are working within a budget and trying to maximize your spend, we would welcome an opportunity to further discuss your goals for the event and the different options available to you. Please call us at 800-592-7043 or fill out this form to get started. We look forward to the opportunity to help you explore your options in renting a luxury suite.
